org.lazywizard.lazylib

Class CollisionUtils

  • Object
    • CollisionUtils

  • public class CollisionUtils
extends Object
    Contains methods for line intersection, bounds and collision detection tests.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    LazyWizard

    • Method Detail

      • getCollisionPoint

        @Nullable
public static @Nullable Vector2f getCollisionPoint(Vector2f lineStart,
                                                              Vector2f lineEnd,
                                                              CombatEntityAPI target)
        Finds the part of the ship that would be intersected by a given path. Important note: if the line is completely within target's bounds, no collision will be detected!
        Parameters:
        target - The CombatEntityAPI to check collision with.
        lineStart - The start of the line to test collision with.
        lineEnd - The end of the line to test collision with.
        Returns:
        The Vector2f of the point the line would hit at, or null if it doesn't hit.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getCollisionPoint

        @Nullable
public static @Nullable Vector2f getCollisionPoint(Vector2f start1,
                                                              Vector2f end1,
                                                              Vector2f start2,
                                                              Vector2f end2)
        Finds the point of intersection between two lines. Accurate to within 1/3 su.
        Parameters:
        start1 - The start of the first line to test collision with.
        end1 - The end of the first line to test collision with.
        start2 - The start of the second line to test collision with.
        end2 - The end of the second line to test collision with.
        Returns:
        The Vector2f that the two lines intersect at, null if they don't collide.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getCollides

        public static boolean getCollides(Vector2f lineStart,
                                  Vector2f lineEnd,
                                  Vector2f circleCenter,
                                  float circleRadius)
        Checks if a line connects with a circle.
        Parameters:
        lineStart - The start point of the line to test.
        lineEnd - The end point of the line to test.
        circleCenter - The center point of the circle.
        circleRadius - The radius of the circle.
        Returns:
        true if the line collides with the circle, false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getNearestPointOnBounds

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull Vector2f getNearestPointOnBounds(Vector2f source,
                                                                  CombatEntityAPI entity)
        Returns the closest point on a CombatEntityAPI's collision bounds to a point. If the entity lacks collision bounds, the closest point on its collision radius will be returned instead.
        Parameters:
        source - The point to check distance from.
        entity - The entity whose bounds will be checked.
        Returns:
        The closest point to source on entity's BoundsAPI, or the closest point on its collision radius if it lacks collision bounds.
        Since:
        2.3

      • isPointWithinCollisionCircle

        public static boolean isPointWithinCollisionCircle(Vector2f point,
                                                   CombatEntityAPI entity)
        Checks if a point is inside the collision circle of a CombatEntityAPI.
        Parameters:
        point - The Vector2f to check.
        entity - The CombatEntityAPI whose BoundsAPI we are checking against.
        Returns:
        true if point is within the collision circle of entity, false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.4

      • isPointOnSegment

        public static boolean isPointOnSegment(Vector2f point,
                                       BoundsAPI.SegmentAPI segment)
        Check if a point is along a BoundsAPI.SegmentAPI. Accurate to within 1/3 su, use MathUtils.isPointOnLine(Vector2f, Vector2f, Vector2f) if you need higher precision.
        Parameters:
        point - The point to check.
        segment - The BoundsAPI.SegmentAPI to check for collision with.
        Returns:
        true if the point is along the line, false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.6b

      • isPointWithinBounds

        public static boolean isPointWithinBounds(Vector2f point,
                                          CombatEntityAPI entity)
        Checks if a point is inside or on the bounds of a CombatEntityAPI.
        Parameters:
        point - The Vector2f to check.
        entity - The CombatEntityAPI whose BoundsAPI we are checking against.
        Returns:
        true if point is within or on the bounds of entity, false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.0
